channel.title: Last stable fw or beta
channel.description: Sorry for noob question but I rarely install betas so I stayed on 1.0.6 (last stable) since december. But now I feel increasingly excluded from all the nice patches that the users here produce. So would you advise me to install 1.0.9 or are there still lots of bugs? And is it possible to install the software on two computers and point the library to a NAS so both have access to the same library (factory, contrib and own)?

item.title: Last stable fw or beta
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

sorry i am not going into childish argument With you again On This subject. 1.08 had a bunch of bugs. They are documrnted on github in 1.09 release notes. Or am i wrong?

Please........

Read full topic

item.title: Last stable fw or beta
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

generally the answer is contained here:

Axoloti Software Releases Software
Current Version 14 December 2015 - 1.0.6 Changes: * Fixes sdcard reader mode * Fixes integration of a better text/code editor with syntax highlighting * Fixes some minor issues * full list of changes: 1.0.5...1.0.6 https://github.com/axoloti/axoloti/releases/latest (runtime is unchanged since version 1.0.2) Pre-release current pre-release available for testing: this thread Note: if you are using a pre-release, please read the following post to understand what pre-releases are for, what â€¦

and no we don't release anything with 'lots of bugs'... @jaffasplaffa comments is I think a little misleading, as with all software, any particular bugs severity will partially be down to how it impacts your work and workflow. i.e. its a minor irritation to some, and major to others.
... I use the development version at all times, so would hardly let a major bug stand.

yes, you can have two different versions install on different computers, and in fact even on the same computer in different directories, in the current release, the later requires you to manually set an environment variable, in 1.0.10 this is made alot simple as its supports 'versioned' instances.

but as with most software, you cannot use patches/objects produced with a future version. e.g. 1.0.8 can use anything prior to 1.0.8, but not post (e.g. 1.0.9 )... from 1.0.10 we actually enforce this.

hence the recommendation, if you are doing something for a performance use the released version, as if you hit a bug, you don't know when it will be fixed. BUT if you can afford to wait, then it will be fixed in a subsequent test build... (thats the point of test releases, to uncover issues so we can fix them!)

so... my recommendation
have 1.0.6 installed, on one machine for performance use.
install 1.0.9 on another, with a copy of stuff from 1.0.6....
do major changes to performance stuff on 1.0.6, but otherwise do future development work on 1.09, and also use it as a chance to test and see how your going to work with 1.0.9+
(once 1.0.10 is release, this will become easier)

oh.. and both @johannes and I do recognise, this test cycle was a too long, and we really need to have the stable version released, this is the priority.

with the post 1.0.6, we decided to try this 'test' cycle as a release process, to encourage feedback and early access and testing ... but Id say its only been partially successful. so I think we will probably need to review the approach for subsequent releases, and either modify it, or do something different... but we will have a bit of time to discuss this whilst in the next development cycle.
( my main goal would be shorter cycles , but frankly, evidence is that this will be tricky in the short term)

Read full topic

item.title: Last stable fw or beta
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

1.08 I only tried one or two times and dropped it again becuae it is was very buggy. Havent had any mayor issues with 1.09.

Yeah, I dont think you can open 1.09 stuff in 1.08. Havent tried, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Last stable fw or beta
item.dc:creator: @urnster Sean Shea
item.description:
@urnster wrote:

So is the reason that I can't open some of the presets because i have ver 1.08?

Read full topic

item.title: Last stable fw or beta
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

mrdrbobo:

So would you advise me to install 1.0.9 or are there still lots of bugs?

Yes upgrade. Almost every patch I have opened have worked. Only a few minor things.

mrdrbobo:

And is it possible to install the software on two computers and point the library to a NAS so both have access to the same library (factory, contrib and own)?

Not a good idea, cause if you open and save a patch in 1.09, you can NOT open it again in 1.06. I made a copy of my whole library, to be on the safe side. So I have 1.06 an 1.09 libraries. Better safe than sorry

Read full topic
